yes:
nvm 
  nvm arch       : Show if node is running in 32 or 64 bit mode.
  nvm install <version> [arch] : The version can be a node.js version or "latest" for the latest stable version.
  nvm list
  nvm list available           : List available node.js versions
  nvm on                       : Enable node.js version management.
  nvm off                      : Disable node.js version management.
  nvm use <version> [arch]     : Switch to a specific node.js version.
  nvm uninstall <version>      : Uninstall a specific node.js version.
  nvm alias default <version>  : Set default node.js version.
  nvm version                  : Display running node.js version.
  nvm run <version> [args...]  : Run a specific node.js version with arguments.
  nvm exec <version> [args...] : Execute a specific version of node.js
  nvm which <version>          : Display path of installed version.
  nvm cache clear              : Clear cached node.js versions.
  nvm help                     : Display this help message.
  nvm ls-remote                : List node.js versions available for install.
  nvm ls                       : List installed node.js versions.
  nvm alias                    : List all aliases.
  nvm alias <name> <version>   : Create an alias for a version.
  nvm unalias <name>           : Remove an alias.
  nvm upgrade                  : Upgrade nvm to the latest version.
  nvm ls-remote --lts          : List LTS (long-term support) versions.
  nvm install --lts            : Install latest LTS version.
  nvm ls available             : List all available versions.
  nvm cache dir                : Display cache directory.
  nvm arch
  nvm alias default
  nvm alias <name>
  nvm help
  nvm cache dir
  nvm version
  nvm run <version>
  nvm exec <version>
  nvm which <version>
  nvm use
  nvm cache clear
  nvm install
  nvm uninstall
  nvm upgrade
  nvm off
  nvm on
  nvm ls
  nvm ls-remote
  nvm ls-remote --lts
  nvm list
  nvm list available
  nvm alias
  nvm unalias <name>
  nvm alias default <version>
